channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Churches Look Skyward for Energy Savings
item.description: Big federal subsidies are driving a surge in solar installations on church rooftops.

item.title: How to prevent one wrong trade from wiping out your investment account
item.description: Successful trading isn’t about finding the perfect system. It’s more about knowing yourself, says Shay Huang, a.k.a. ‘Humbled Trader.’

item.title: ‘I have little faith in the world right now’: My husband died after a long illness and our joint bank account was frozen. How could this happen?
item.description: “Am I still the joint owner of this account?”

item.title: ‘I have few close friends’: I’m 69, retired, single and have amassed $3.6 million. What should I do with my fortune?
item.description: “Many weeks I spend more on my three rescue kitties and one rescue mouse than I do on myself.”

item.title: Pfizer's Activist Battle Might Fizzle---but Its Stock Probably Won't
item.description: The pharmaceutical company’s stock is relatively cheap, representing an opportunity for patient value investors.

item.title: The Score: McDonald's, Tesla, Spirit Airlines and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: These 3 struggles sent this retired couple back to the U.S. after a move overseas
item.description: Moving to Portugal in retirement was a dream — but they weren’t ready for the reality.

item.title: One reason I’m suspicious of Medicare Advantage? I’m a capitalist.
item.description: The downside of Medicare Advantage is that you are dependent for your health-insurance coverage on an organization that has powerful economic incentiv...

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.88% This Week
item.description: The dollar continued higher, bringing its weekly rise to nearly 0.9%.
